features.name: Keeper Spells
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you always have the following spells prepared, and they don't count against your number of spells known:

items: 2nd Level: <spell spare the dying>, <spell cure wounds>, <spell life sap|ULDNecromancerClass>
5th Level: <spell aura of vitality>, <spell beacon of hope>
7th Level: <spell aura of life>, <spell aura of purity>
9th Level: <spell greater restoration>, <spell mass cure wounds>

features.name: Life on Demand
entries: As an action, you touch a willing creature. It expends one Hit Die, rolls it, and adds your Charisma modifier. It regains hit points equal to the total (minimum 1).
You can use this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (min 1). You regain all uses after a long rest.

features.name: Deliverer
entries: As a reaction when you or a creature within 30 feet is hit by a critical hit, you can turn it into a normal hit. Any effects triggered by a critical hit are canceled.
You can use this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (min 1). You regain all uses after a long rest.

features.name: Aura of Wellbeing
entries: When an undead starts its turn within 10 feet of you, you can grant it temporary HP equal to 1d6 + your Charisma modifier.
You can also grant temp HP this way to any creature within 10 feet that starts its turn with half or fewer hit points remaining.

features.name: Master of Mending
entries: Whenever you roll dice to restore HP with a spell or Necromancer feature, use the maximum value of each die instead.
Necromancers of this Occult study death in order to keep it at bay. Keepers understand how and why creatures die, and how to prevent it.
